name: 霍弘毅
objective: In this course we will 1. Learn the formal requirements for an MLA Research Paper from research notes, quoting, paraphrasing, and summarizing to the Works Cited page; 2. Learn the basic principles for the creation and organization of an MA paper from Topic to Narrow Topic to Working Research Questions to Final Research Question to Thesis development; and 3. Learn contemporary critical theoretical contexts and how to apply theory to your topic and thesis.
schedule:
Pt I: Formal MLA Requirements, Research, and Organization of the MA paper
Pt II: Critical and Theoretical Contexts Feminism, Postmodernism, Marxism, Psychoanalysis, Queer Theory, et al.
scorePolicy:
Mid-Term Exam: 40%
Final Paper of 5-7 pages in correct MLA format plus Works Cited (at least 5): 60%
materials: MLA Guide for the Writers of Research Papers
